byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Michael M. Grynbaum from New York.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

abstract: Questions of political chicanery circulate in Albany after New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo calls all-hands-on-deck cabinet meeting that coincides with budget presentation by New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio; Cuomo states that he did not intend to upstage mayor, but many say move fits pattern in which Cuomo administration has steadily outmaneuvered de Blasio on a range of issues.
lead_paragraph: Questions about Capitol chicanery ran rampant in Albany on Wednesday after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo held a cabinet meeting at the same time as Mayor Bill de Blasio’s budget presentation to state lawmakers.

headline.main: De Blasio, in Albany to Discuss Budget, Faces Competition From Cuomo
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, in Albany to Discuss Budget, Faces Competition From Cuomo

snippet: Questions about Capitol chicanery ran rampant in Albany on Wednesday after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo held a cabinet meeting at the same time as Mayor Bill de Blasio’s budget presentation to state lawmakers.
